ygData.subject: Is it just me or has EQ gotten boring?
ygData.msgSnippet: When I first started playing EQ I played hardcore. I made some friends and I played with them almost 24/7. I have started and deleted a character from just
ygData.messageBody:
When I first started playing EQ I played
hardcore. I made some friends and I played with them almost
24/7. I have started and deleted a character from just
about every class there is.<br><br> Now, most of my old
friends are gone. The ones that still play have leveled
there characters to far for me to play with them
anymore. I still love playing, but I seem to find that it
is not as much fun as before. I currently have 5
characters, the highest being a level 24 druid. My friend,
who started his druid after I did mine, is now at
level 48. Granted I was away from EQ for a 3 months
period, where my friend was playing to beat the band.
<br><br> My friend has been playing longer than I have. He
has a nack for knowing what mobs to kill to get the
best XP vs LOOT ratio. I on the other hand have been
at level 24 ten times now. I have a nack for dieing
and losing my level again and again. It is very
frustrating to watch someone level so fast, while you get
stuck behind. <br><br> I find myself not playing EQ
quite as much as I once did. Is there anyone else here
who has had similar problems? If so, were you able to
make it fun again?<br><br>thanks for letting me vent.
:)<br><br>Brendel Bushwaker 24 Druid
